thread.title: Don Mattingly out as LA Dodgers manager
thread.title_full: Don Mattingly out as LA Dodgers manager

author: BETH HARRIS, AP Sports Writer
title: Don Mattingly out as LA Dodgers manager
text: Dodgers and Mattingly part ways in mutual agreement Beth Harris, Ap Sports Writer Updated 9:43 am, Thursday, October 22, 2015 Photo: Frank Franklin II, AP Image 1 of / 8 Close Image 1 of 8 In this Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, file photo, Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly speaks during a news conference before Game 3 of baseball’s National League Division Series against the New York Mets in New York. A person familiar with the decision tells The Associated Press that Don Mattingly is out as manager of the Dodgers. The person spoke on the condition of anonymity Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, because the team has not announced his departure. In this Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, file photo, Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly speaks during a news conference before Game 3 of baseball’s National League Division Series against the New York Mets in ... more Image 2 of 8 Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Zack Greinke hands the ball to manager Don Mattingly, right, as he leaves the game during the seventh inning in Game 5 of baseball's National League Division Series against the New York Mets Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in Los Angeles. Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Zack Greinke hands the ball to manager Don Mattingly, right, as he leaves the game during the seventh inning in Game 5 of baseball's National League Division Series against ... more Image 3 of 8 Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly, left, and New York Mets manager Terry Collins, right, talk during batting practice before the Los Angeles Dodgers play the New York Mets in Game 5 of baseball's National League Division Series Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in Los Angeles. Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly, left, and New York Mets manager Terry Collins, right, talk during batting practice before the Los Angeles Dodgers play the New York Mets in Game 5 of baseball's ... more Image 4 of 8 Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series that is set to begin on Friday against the New York Mets, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series that is set to begin on Friday against the New York Mets, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 ... more Image 5 of 8 Manager Don Mattingly and Hall of Fame manager and current executive Tommy Lasorda of the Los Angeles Dodgers talk after a ceremony celebrating Lasorda's 88th birthday on the field before the game with the Arizona Diamondbacks at Dodger Stadium on September 22, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. Manager Don Mattingly and Hall of Fame manager and current executive Tommy Lasorda of the Los Angeles Dodgers talk after a ceremony celebrating Lasorda's 88th birthday on the field before the game with the ... more Image 6 of 8 Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly gestures as he answers questions about Chase Utley's hard slide into New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada, who suffered a broken leg in Game 2 of the NLDS, during a press conference, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, at CitiField in New York. Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly gestures as he answers questions about Chase Utley's hard slide into New York Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada, who suffered a broken leg in Game 2 of the NLDS, during a ... more Image 7 of 8 Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 ... more Image 8 of 8 Dodgers and Mattingly part ways in mutual agreement 1 / 8 Back to Gallery LOS ANGELES (AP) — Don Mattingly won't return as manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers next year after agreeing with his bosses that he and the team needed a fresh start. Mattingly said Thursday in a statement distributed by the team that it's "the right time and right move for both parties." Los Angeles was 446-363 in five years under Mattingly, finishing with a winning record in every season and claiming the last three NL West titles. But the Dodgers have not reached the World Series since winning the championship in 1988. The 54-year-old former Yankees star ranks sixth in wins among Dodgers managers. Related Stories
